benchmark_details.name: SiT (Self-supervised vIsion Transformer)
benchmark_details.overview: SiT is the first masked image modeling work for vision transformers that establishes that self-supervised pretraining can outperform supervised pretraining for downstream applications.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To learn a representation of the data in an unsupervised fashion using group masked model learning and estimate different geometric transformations applied to the input image.

data.source: Publicly available datasets for image classification and segmentation tasks.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the standard classification tasks on the respective datasets, obtaining state-of-the-art results.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metric values indicate better performance on the respective visual tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: SiT consistently outperforms supervised pretraining and achieves state-of-the-art results on several benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using standard protocols on benchmark datasets including ImageNet-1K.
